pullRequest.body:
The current definition of `Algebra.id` is `(RingHom.id _).toAlgebra`. The problem with this is that `RingHom.id` is a `def` and is not reducible. Thus Lean will often refuse to unfold it causing unification to fail unecessarily in typeclass searches. This overrides the data fields from `RingHom.id`.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body: !bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/b7a2b2f7-7a73-4b7c-a3ac-8d4bd5a66448) for commit a7e6d97c87b7acd46d50ddd1a620bb5bc1456210.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/4cd496fd-5c5b-4996-9a83-08860f566bcc/to/b7a2b2f7-7a73-4b7c-a3ac-8d4bd5a66448) against commit bc9337e5704b1dfb8d4b95e2fad1cd80ead1200e.

The benchmark doesn't look particularly convincing; is there a test-case you have in mind where this definitely makes a difference, even if it doesn't make much of a difference to mathlib overall? If so, can you add it to the `tests` directory?

> The benchmark doesn't look particularly convincing; is there a test-case you have in mind where this definitely makes a difference, even if it doesn't make much of a difference to mathlib overall? If so, can you add it to the `tests` directory?

I wasn’t expecting a speed up. In fact, I was worried about a slowdown. This is about restoring sane behavior for `simp` see [Zulip1](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/270676-lean4/topic/simp.20.5BX.5D.20fails.2C.20rw.20.5BX.5D.20works) [Zulip2](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/270676-lean4/topic/Simp.20claims.20not.20defeq.20but.20rfl.20works) 

This also resolves the discussion at leanprover/lean4#2461
I’ve added the example from the first topic as a test
From the second Zulip discussion, the attempt to fix the behavior in #9020 was a bit ad-hoc while #9025 was awful for performance.

:v: mattrobball can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7644495473/job/20828935469)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7644495473/job/20828935921)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7644495473/job/20828935216)

bors d+

Thanks!

bors d+

Thanks!
These instance are nasty enough anyway that probably making them reducible doesn't make much difference. Could you benchmark this pair of changes separately?
Sure. Let me see this impact together first. But I'll do it either way.
Actually taking a look at the benchmark results here, do you still want this split?
Eh, already had it queued up #9952
I just restored them to `default`. I only realize now that I was operating off a previous attempt and didn't need this.
Can you use `where` notation here?
Do you want me to use `Tactic.Spread` or just specify by hand?
Oh, is `Tactic.Spread` not imported here?
You are correct, it is. This is done now.
Did you revert it again?
Did you revert it again?
Accidentally. It is back now.

```suggestion
  toFun x := x
  smul r x := r * x
```
Though arguably we should omit the `smul` field too and use `toSMul` instead, since that will avoid eta-expansion of `SMul`
~~Done~~ I can’t use `(RingHom.id R).toAlgebra.toSMul` so what term of `SMul` should I put that isn’t already eta expanded?
I did incorporate the changes suggested above.
`Mul.toSMul`, or `inferInstance`
I used the former

```suggestion
  toFun x := x
  toSMul := Mul.toSMul _
  __ := (RingHom.id R).toAlgebra
```
Oops. Done.

```suggestion
/-- Every commutative ring is an algebra over itself -/
instance id : Algebra R R where
  /- We override the data fields `toFun` and `smul` because `RingHom.id` is not reducible.
  See note [reducible non-instances] for a related explanation. -/
```
I don't think this belongs in the docstring, it's an implementation detail.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(Algebra.Basic): override `toFun` and `smul` in `Algebra.id`
